ApproxsimClient.object.primitive
Class Reference

java.lang.Object
  ApproxsimClient.object.primitive.Reference

public class Reference
extends Object

A reference is used to reference an identifiable object (the resolve mechanism is scope dependent).

          Creates a new reference.

resolve

public ApproxsimObject resolve(ApproxsimObject scope)
Returns object referenced by this reference. Tries to resolv the reference in every scope up to the root.

Parameters:
scope - the scope in which this reference is to be resolved or null if unable to resolv.

debugResolve

public ApproxsimObject debugResolve(ApproxsimObject scope)
Returns object referenced by this reference. Tries to resolv the reference in every scope up to the root.

Parameters:
scope - the scope in which this reference is to be resolved or null if unable to resolv.

scope The scope for this reference.

equals

public boolean equals(Reference r)
Checks for equality. Notice that it is guaranteed that the hashcode for two References A and B is equal when A.equals(B) returns true.

author Per Alexius

Parameters:
r - The Reference to compare to.
Returns:
true if the References refer to the same object.

parseReference

public static Reference parseReference(String str)
Tries to create a new reference from the provided string. Returns null iff the supplied string is empty or if any component (i. e. scope) is defined to be empty (e. g. a::b or :). FIXME: should throw suitable excpetion instead of returning null on error.

Parameters:
str - the string to use

getLength

public int getLength()
Returns the length of the reference (i. e. number of components)

toTaclanV2

public String toTaclanV2()
Returns a String holding this object in its Taclan V2 representation.

clone

public Object clone()
Clones this object. Notice that the Identifier is NOT cloned. Both the clone and the original object will thus keep a reference to the same Identifier object.

author Per Alexius

Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
A clone of this object.

Gets a Reference from the element n.

Parameters:
n - The parent Node.
Returns:
The newly created Reference.
